name: o-diethylbenzene
source: American Petroleum Institute. Research Project 44; Selected Values of Properties of Hydrocarbons and Related Compounds. Texas A & M University; College Station; TX; 1973.
Reason: 1,1-diethylbenzene has a melting point of -100.0 degrees Celsius. The introduction of two additional phenyl rings linked in a linear fashion significantly enhances the melting point due to the increase in molecular weight and pi-pi interactions. Each additional phenyl group can be estimated to add approximately 100°C to the melting point.
